item.description: Public / Media Advisory; 10:45PM; #GranadaHills / #PorterRanch; The cause of this evening's two brush fires alongside the eastbound Ronald Reagan (SR118) Freeway between Hayvenhurst Avenue (LAFD Incident #1853) and Reseda Boulevard (LAFD Incident #1841) are connected, and considered to be incendiary in nature. Eyewitnesses informed the California Highway Patrol (West Valley Log #3318) that one or more persons were seen discharging fireworks from a black van. Anyone with information regarding the suspect(s) is encouraged to notify law enforcement anonymously via Crimestoppers by calling 1-800-222-TIPS.; - Brian Humphrey

Update Brush Fire; INC#1853; 09:50PM; EB 118 Fwy x Hayvenhurst Av; MAP: https://bit.ly/3wolwUt; #GranadaHills; Despite erratic wind with embercast, 73 LAFD ground-based Firefighters took just one hour to stop forward progress of this fire, holding it to (yet to be determined size) brush, grass and trees adjacent to the eastbound lanes of the Ronald Reagan Freeway near Hayvenhurst Avenue. No injury. No structures damaged. Firefighters will remain at scene to continue containment and overhaul. This fire is under investigation. There is *presently* no correlation determined between this fire, and a concurrent brush fire that burned to the west near Reseda Blvd (LAFD Incident #1841).; FS 18; Batt 15; Valley Bureau; Council District 12; AO1 AO2 BC10 BC12 BC14 CM42 E100 E103 E106 E18 E24 E287 E290 E75 E83 E84 E93 EM15 H2 H4 H5 HA2 HA4 HA5 RA18 T87 T90; CH5; 13; Brian Humphrey

Update Brush Fire; INC#1841; 09:45PM; EB 118 Fwy x Reseda Bl; MAP: https://bit.ly/3N8uqMk; #PorterRanch; Despite a 10 mph wind with embercast, 74 LAFD ground-based Firefighters took just one hour to stop forward progress of the fire, holding it to (yet to be determined size) brush adjacent to the eastbound lanes of the Ronald Reagan Freeway. No injury. No structures damaged. Firefighters will remain at scene to continue containment and overhaul. Fire cause under investigation.; FS 8; Batt 15; Valley Bureau; Council District 12; BC15 BC17 E103 E104 E106 E28 E287 E290 E296 E70 E87 EM17 H5 HA5 RA107 RA90 T87 T90 T96; CH5; 18; Brian Humphrey

Brush Fire; INC#1853; 08:51PM; EB 118 Fwy x Hayvenhurst Av; MAP: https://bit.ly/3wolwUt; #GranadaHills; PRELIM: LAFD ground and air response to as much as one (1) acre of brush burning adjacent to the eastbound lanes of the Ronald Reagan Freeway.; FS 18; Batt 15; Valley Bureau; Council District 12; BC10 E100 E18 E75 E93; CH8; 13; Brian Humphrey

Brush Fire; INC#1841; 08:45PM; EB 118 Fwy x Reseda Bl; MAP: https://bit.ly/3w9rnxY; #PorterRanch; PRELIM: LAFD ground response to one-quarter (0.25) acre brush burning adjacent to the freeway, fanned by 10 MPH wind. No structure threat.; FS 28; Batt 15; Valley Bureau; Council District 12; BC15 BC17 E103 E104 E28 E287 E290 E296 E70 E87 EM17 RA107 T87 T90 T96; CH5; 18; Brian Humphrey

Controlled - Brush Fire; INC#1063; 04:45PM; 22807 W Santa Susana Pass Rd; MAP: https://bit.ly/34ODrGH; #Chatsworth / #SantaSusanPass; With the help of a Ventura County FD Engine Company, and a trio of LAFD Helicopters, the first 30 arriving LAFD ground crews were able to fully extinguish and overhaul the stubborn spot fire that erupted in volatile brush in a rugged canyon distant from the initial fire. A missing and thankfully uninjured pet dog that had escaped from one of the badly damaged vehicles was found in remote terrain by LAFD responders, and safely placed in the care of a family member who later responded to the scene. The dog's owner, a 45 year-old male driver taken by LAFD Paramedics to an area hospital, amazingly suffered only non-life threatening injuries. The adult male driver of the other vehicle declined treatment or ambulance transportation. No other persons were injured. No structures were threatened. The collision is being investigated by LAPD Valley Traffic Division (Incident #2701); FS 96; Batt 15; Valley Bureau; Council District 12; AO1 AO2 BC10 BC12 BC15 BC17 BP28 BP8 CM42 E104 E105 E106 E28 E290 E296 E70 E8 E87 E90 EM15 H2 H3 H4 H5 HA2 HA3 HA4 HA5 RA100 RA104 RA898 RA96 T90 T96 + VCFD; CH8; 18; Brian Humphrey

Update Brush Fire; INC#1063; 02:25PM; 22807 W Santa Susana Pass Rd; MAP: https://bit.ly/34ODrGH; #Chatsworth #SantaSusanaPass; This fire is within LAFD jurisdiction. Though first arriving LAFD ground units were able to limit forward progress of flames at about 200 square-feet of vegetation and extinguish the two burning vehicles, they are still working with VCFD Engine 43 and three LAFD helicopters to extinguish a stubborn spot fire that erupted down canyon amid volatile brush. No structures are currently threatened. LAFD Paramedics have transported one of the two patients injured in the traffic collision to an area hospital, while the other patient is declining treatment or ambulance transportation. CHP West Valley (Log #1773) and LAPD Valley Traffic Division (Incident #2701) Officers are responding to determine jurisdictional authority for the collision investigation.; FS 96; Batt 15; Valley Bureau; Council District 12; AO1 AO2 BC10 BC12 BC15 BC17 CM42 E104 E105 E106 E28 E290 E296 E70 E8 E87 EM15 H2 H3 H5 HA2 HA3 HA5 RA96 T90 T96; CH5; 18; Brian Humphrey

Brush Fire; INC#1063; 02:11PM; 22807 W Santa Susana Pass Rd; MAP: https://bit.ly/34ODrGH; #Chatsworth #SantaSusanaPass; PRELIM: LAFD ground and air response with allied agencies (LACoFD & VCFD) to a 2 vehicle collision (unknown yet if injuries) which led to both vehicles being fully involved in fire, with flames spreading to involve ~ 200 square-feet of nearby medium density brush and grass. Moderate rate of flame spread. No structure threat.; FS 96; Batt 15; Valley Bureau; Council District 12; BC15 BC17 E104 E105 E106 E28 E296 E70 E8 EM15 H0C H0D RA96 T96 + LACoFD + VCFD; CH5; 18; Brian Humphrey

Knockdown - Vegetation Fire; INC#0824; 12:31PM; 12920 W Magnolia Bl; MAP: https://bit.ly/3PvGJVg; #ShermanOaks; *Corrected to Vegetation Fire* 29 LAFD Firefighters took just 22 minutes to confine and fully extinguish flammable vegetation and multiple tall trees ablaze on a vacant 50' x 50' lot. They prevented flames from damaging an adjacent two-story home. No injury. No structure damage. Fire cause under investigation.; FS 102; Batt 14; Valley Bureau; Council District 4; AR1 BC10 BC12 BC14 E108 E239 E260 E278 E89 RA78 RA878 T39 T60; CH9; 17; Brian Humphrey

Structure Fire; INC#0824; 12:09PM; 12920 W Magnolia Bl; MAP: https://bit.ly/3PvGJVg; #ShermanOaks; PRELIM: 50' x 50' vacant lot with flammable vegetation and many tall trees ablaze, flames threatening an adjacent two-story home to the west.; FS 102; Batt 14; Valley Bureau; Council District 4; BC10 BC12 BC14 E108 E239 E260 E278 E89 RA78 RA878 T39 T60; CH9; 17; Brian Humphrey
